author: David
title: The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church: A Review Of Its Architectural Marvels
text:
Le grand grimoire by Benjamin Johnson Issuu from issuu.com As a lover of architecture, I have always been fascinated by the intricate designs and structures of churches. The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church is one such masterpiece that has always intrigued me. Its towering spires, intricate stained-glass windows, and ornate decorations make it a true marvel of architectural design. In this review, I will explore the different aspects of this magnificent church that make it a true testament to human creativity and ingenuity.
Located in the heart of a bustling metropolis, The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church is a sight to behold. Its imposing façade consists of a series of arches that lead to the entrance of the church. The façade is decorated with intricate sculptures and carvings that depict scenes from the Bible. The towers of the church are adorned with gargoyles that serve as symbolic guardians of the church. The interior of the church is equally impressive, with its high ceilings, ornate altars, and intricate frescoes that cover the walls and ceilings.
Table of Contents
The Architecture of the Main Sanctuary The Stained-Glass Windows of the Church The Sculptures and Carvings of the Church The Bell Tower of the Church The Architecture of the Main Sanctuary The main sanctuary of The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church is a true masterpiece of architectural design. The sanctuary is designed in the shape of a cross, with the altar located at the center of the cross. The sanctuary is divided into three sections, each with its own unique design. The first section is the nave, which is the main area of the church where the congregation sits. The nave is designed in the shape of a cross, with the arms of the cross leading to the side aisles. The second section is the transept, which is the area where the choir and the clergy sit. The transept is designed in the shape of a Latin cross, with the arms of the cross leading to the side chapels. The third section is the apse, which is the area where the altar is located. The apse is designed in the shape of a semicircle, with the altar at the center of the circle.
The Stained-Glass Windows of the Church The stained-glass windows of The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church are another marvel of architectural design. The windows are designed in the Gothic style, with intricate designs and patterns that depict scenes from the Bible. The windows are made up of thousands of pieces of colored glass that are held together by lead strips. The colors of the glass range from deep blues and greens to vibrant reds and yellows. The windows are located throughout the church, with the largest and most impressive window located behind the altar in the apse.
The Sculptures and Carvings of the Church The sculptures and carvings of The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church are a testament to the skill and creativity of the artists who created them. The interior of the church is adorned with intricate sculptures and carvings that depict scenes from the Bible. The sculptures are made of marble and stone, and are located throughout the church. The carvings are located on the walls and ceilings of the church, and are made of wood and stone. The carvings depict scenes from the Bible, as well as symbolic figures that represent the virtues of faith, hope, and charity.
The Bell Tower of the Church The bell tower of The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church is another impressive feature of the church. The tower is located at the front of the church, and is designed in the Gothic style. The tower is made of stone, and is adorned with intricate carvings and sculptures. The tower houses several bells, which are rung to signal the beginning and end of services. The tower also serves as a landmark for the city, and is visible from several miles away.
In conclusion, The Grand Grimoire Catholic Church is a true masterpiece of architectural design. Its soaring spires, intricate stained-glass windows, and ornate decorations make it a true testament to human creativity and ingenuity. The church is a symbol of faith and devotion, and a reminder of the importance of beauty and art in our lives.
Topic Aspect Main Sanctuary Architecture Stained-Glass Windows Design and Patterns Sculptures and Carvings Materials and Location Bell Tower Design and Function

author: Rebeca Gil
title: Cribado de cáncer de pulmón: así es la fórmula eficaz contra la segunda causa de muerte
text: El cáncer de pulmón y bronquios es el más mortal en España, según los últimos registros disponibles. Y aunque los avances han permitido mejorar algunas de las cifras, lo cierto es que según los últimos datos de la Sociedad Española de Oncología Médica (SEOM), en España se detectarán este año 33.000 casos. Mueren a causa de esta enfermedad 23.000 personas. Además, el cáncer de pulmón sigue siendo la principal causa de muerte por cáncer. Porque si bien es cierto que en hombres la incidencia y la mortalidad tiende a estabilizarse desde los años 90, según un estudio reciente del grupo de Investigación del Cáncer de Pulmón en Mujeres (ICAPEM), la incidencia y mortalidad del cáncer de pulmón en mujeres se ha duplicado entre 2003 y 2019, con un incremento del 124%. Y la edad media al fallecimiento por cáncer de pulmón en España se encuentra en el rango de edad de 70 a 74 años entre los hombres, y en el grupo de edad de 65 a 69 años entre las mujeres, según del Observatorio de la Asociación Española Contra el Cáncer. En la Semana Europea del Cáncer de Pulmón es una fecha importante para generar conciencia sobre este tumor y los malos hábitos que pueden desencadenarlo. El principal factor de riesgo para desarrollar cáncer de pulmón es el tabaquismo, aunque existen otras causas que pueden favorecer su desarrollo, como la exposición al radón siendo este el segundo factor de riesgo. El problema es que este tipo de tumores se detectan cuando ya están en estados muy avanzados, lo que complica su tratamiento y curación. De ahí la importancia de realizar cribados, tal y como se hace con otros tipos de cánceres como el de colon. ¿Qué es cribado de cáncer pulmonar? Pues se trata de una sencilla prueba de imagen, la tomografía computarizada, lo que todos conocemos como TAC, realizada con bajas dosis de radiación (TCBD). Y según los expertos de la Sociedad Española de Neumología y Cirugía Torácica (SEPAR) realizar esta prueba en pacientes de alto riesgo, permitiría una reducción global de la mortalidad por cáncer de pulmón. Son muchos los estudios internacionales que así lo señalan. El estudio NELSON, por ejemplo, consiguió una mayor reducción de la mortalidad por esta patología en pacientes con determinadas características: En mayores de 55 años que fuman más de 30 paquetes al año\n En individuos más jóvenes, menos de 50, y con menos hábito tabáquico a sus espaldas (menos de 15 paquetes año). Gracias al cribado al que se sometieron estos pacientes, se redujo la mortalidad por cáncer de pulmón en hombres en un 26% tras diez años de seguimiento. Además, el 50% de los cánceres de pulmón detectados con la tomografía computarizada en el estudio NELSON se encontraba en estadio inicial, en comparación con un 75% de estadios avanzados (III o IV) en el grupo control. De momento, en España no está implantado un programa de cribado de cáncer de pulmón. Por eso desde la SEPAR insisten en la necesidad de la puesta en marcha de esta herramienta de detección eficaz de este tipo de tumores. \"El cáncer de pulmón es una pandemia evitable. Desde SEPAR queremos trabajar en dos frentes para conseguir disminuir los casos y la mortalidad por este cáncer: Mediante el impulso de estrategias para conseguir que cada vez más personas dejen de fumar\n Mediante la defensa de la implantación de programas de cribado del cáncer de pulmón. Los estudios científicos avalan la puesta en marcha de estos programas porque evitan muertes y logran detectar los casos en estadios iniciales\", insiste el doctor Carlos A. Jiménez, presidente de SEPAR. Como afirma el doctor Juan Carlos Trujillo, cirujano torácico y coordinador del Área de Oncología de SEPAR.: \"Sabemos que todavía hay mucho por hacer contra el tabaquismo ya que han demostrado las políticas antitabaco actuales ser insuficientes, pero si no se lleva a la práctica el programa de cribado de cáncer de pulmón estaremos siendo testigos silenciosos de la alta mortalidad por cáncer de pulmón, cuando podría evitarse\

author: Barbados Today
title: BWU secures major wages and conditions improvements for CAH employees
text:
Deputy General Secretary of the Barbados Workers’ Union, Dwaine Paul, has announced significant advancements following a successful lobby with the Caribbean Aircraft Handling (CAH) team.
These improvements encompass the regularization of over 100 workers from part-time to full-time employment, retroactive pay adjustments, salary increases in line with government standards, and revisions to terms and conditions pertaining to uniforms and other areas.
Paul highlighted the significance of these achievements, stating, “As part of the airport group’s ongoing efforts, there’s a commitment to bring better and greater things to the entire airport family in 2024.” This statement underscores the union’s dedication to continuous improvement and advocacy for employees.
President of the CAH division, Jason Layne expressed profound gratitude towards the Barbados Workers’ Union for their pivotal role in resolving major issues at the airport.
Layne remarked, “This development marks a significant step towards ensuring that the company is invested in the workers as much as the workers are in them.” This sentiment reflects a mutual commitment to the well-being and satisfaction of the workforce.
Further, the President called upon more workers to come together in the quest for bigger and greater achievements in the future, emphasizing the importance of unity and collaboration for continued progress.
(PR)

author: AFP
title: Tension au large du Yémen: nouvelles frappes américaines, nouvelle attaque des Houthis - 01/02/2024 à 23:31
text:
Photo diffusée par la marine américaine d'un destroyer Arleigh Burke USS Carney opérant en mer Méditerranée, le 1er juillet 2017 ( Marine américaine / Xavier JIMENEZ )
L'armée américaine a abattu un drone au large du Yémen jeudi et détruit un drone de surface naval sans équipage chargé d'explosifs en mer Rouge, alors que les rebelles Houthis continuent de menacer le trafic maritime dans la région.
Le Commandement militaire américain au Moyen-Orient (Centcom) a par ailleurs annoncé que ce mouvement yéménite proche de l'Iran avait lancé deux missiles visant potentiellement un cargo, mais sans le toucher.
Le drone a été abattu au-dessus du golfe d'Aden tôt jeudi, a déclaré le Centcom, sans préciser à qui il appartenait.
Il a toutefois imputé aux Houthis la responsabilité du navire drone, dont la destruction a provoqué des "explosions annexes importantes", mais pas de blessés ou de dégâts matériels.
Carte montrant la mer Rouge, le Golfe d'Aden et la zone contrôlée par les rebelles Houthis au Yémen ( AFP / Valentin RAKOVSKY )
L'armée américaine avait auparavant annoncé avoir notamment détruit dix drones Houthis et trois iraniens, dans une série de frappes.
Ces dernières semaines, les rebelles, qui contrôlent une grande partie du Yémen en guerre, ont multiplié les attaques visant des navires en mer Rouge et dans le golfe d'Aden, passages essentiels du commerce mondial.
- "Escalade" - Les Houthis disent agir en solidarité avec les Palestiniens de Gaza, territoire assiégée et bombardé par Israël, en guerre contre le mouvement Hamas depuis l'attaque sanglante mené par ce dernier en sol israélien le 7 octobre.
Mercredi vers 20H30 (17H30 GMT), les rebelles Houthis "ont lancé un missile balistique antinavire (...) vers le golfe d'Aden", a annoncé le Centcom dans un communiqué.
Des partisans armés des rebelles Houthis du Yémen lors d'un rassemblement à Sanaa en soutien au mouvement palestinien Hamas, le 1er février 2024 ( AFP / MOHAMMED HUWAIS )
Moins d'une heure après, ce même destroyer a "abattu trois drones iraniens" qui se trouvaient "à proximité", a ajouté le Centcom.
Dans la soirée, il a encore annoncé que des frappes américaines avaient détruit dix drones d'attaque et un poste de commandement Houthis, qui "constituaient une menace imminente pour les navires marchands et les navires militaires américains".
Plus tôt mercredi, l'armée américaine avait en outre dit avoir détruit un missile sol-air des Houthis prêt à être tiré depuis le Yémen et qui menaçait, selon elle, des avions américains.
Ils ont affirmé mercredi avoir visé un bâtiment américain, le USS Gravely.
D'autres groupes armés pro-iraniens ont attaqué ces derniers mois des bases américaines en Irak et en Syrie.
L'une de ces attaques, a coûté dimanche la vie à trois militaires américains en Jordanie, à la frontière syrienne. Washington l'a imputée à la "Résistance islamique en Irak", une nébuleuse de combattants issus de groupes armés pro-Iran, Téhéran réfutant toute implication.
Les Etats-Unis et l'Iran ont plusieurs fois répété qu'ils ne cherchaient pas une "escalade" des tensions au Moyen-Orient, dans le contexte de la guerre à Gaza.
- "Dernier recours" - Le Premier ministre britannique Rishi Sunak a une nouvelle fois appelé jeudi à l'arrêt des attaques "inconsidérées" des Houthis, lors d'un entretien téléphonique avec le sultan Haitham d'Oman, pays voisin du Yémen et médiateur important entre l'Iran et les pays occidentaux.
Le Premier ministre britannique Rishi Sunak à la sortie du 10 Downing Street, le 31 janvier 2024 à Londres ( AFP / JUSTIN TALLIS )
Rishi Sunak, dont le pays a mené plusieurs frappes conjointes contre les Houthis avec Washington, "a souligné que l'action militaire n'était qu'un dernier recours face à des menaces intolérables pour la navigation mondiale", selon un communiqué de son bureau.
Dans le golfe d'Aden, un autre navire marchand a été touché par un missile, qui a provoqué une explosion à bord, a indiqué jeudi la société britannique de sécurité maritime Ambrey.
Les Houthis, qui affirment viser des navires liés à Israël, ont mené plus de 35 attaques contre des navires au large du Yémen depuis le 19 novembre, selon le ministère américain de la Défense.
Avant de lancer des frappes en janvier, les Etats-Unis, principal allié d'Israël, avaient déployé des navires de guerre en mer Rouge et mis en place une coalition maritime internationale pour "protéger" cette zone cruciale par où transite jusqu'à 12% du commerce mondial.
Depuis, les Houthis considèrent également les navires liés aux Etats-Unis ou au Royaume-Uni comme des "cibles légitimes".
Washington a annoncé mi-janvier les désigner à nouveau comme une entité "terroriste".
L'impact de ces tensions dans cette zone est lourd: le transport maritime de conteneurs par la mer Rouge a chuté de près de 30% sur un an, a annoncé mercredi le Fonds monétaire international (FMI).

author: RFI
title: The Gaza mothers separated from their newborns by war
text:
The Gaza mothers separated from their newborns by war
Jerusalem (AFP) – As their first birthday approaches, the triplets Gaza-native Hanane Bayouk gave birth to in Jerusalem before the war have seen their mother just once, and she fears she will "die without them".
Issued on: Modified:
The 26-year-old had to return to the Palestinian territory alone after giving birth to Najoua, Nour and Najmeh on August 24, 2023, because her Israeli travel permit had expired.
Bayouk received a permit to exit Gaza and give birth in annexed east Jerusalem's Al-Maqased hospital after seven years of painful IVF procedures.
She caught a glimpse of her children in their incubators, "barely an hour and a half", before driving back to Gaza after her permit "expired and the hospital told me to leave".
Bayouk was supposed to return in early October after her daughters had spent several weeks in incubators, which were in short supply in hospitals in Gaza even before the Israel-Hamas war erupted last October.
'Far from the war'
Two days after she applied for a new exit permit on October 5, Hamas commandos blasted through the Erez terminal, the only entry point from Gaza into Israel.
Once in Israel, the militants carried out an unprecedented attack that left 1,198 people dead, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally based on Israeli official figures.
Israel's retaliatory military campaign has killed 40,265 Palestinians in Gaza, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry, which does not give details of civilian and militant deaths. The UN rights office says most of the dead have been women or children.
Like Bayouk, Heba Idriss found herself surrounded by war and unable to return to Jerusalem to get her only daughter, Saida, born prematurely at the Maqased two months earlier.
The 27-year-old had hoped to bring her newborn back to her husband Saleh at their home in Shujaiya, in the northern Gaza Strip.
Instead, the couple has been displaced nine times by Israeli air strikes or evacuation orders and her husband Saleh has only seen pictures of Saida.
"I want to see my daughter, I suffer so much from being separated from her", she said in tears.
Hanane Bayouk too has been forced from her home and now lives in a displacement persons' camp in the south, sharing a tent with seven of her in-laws.
"It drives me crazy. It took me so long to get pregnant, and now I'm crying all the time," she told AFP on one of the rare days she was able to get through on Gaza's struggling phone network.
"Sometimes, I think I'd like for my daughters to return to Gaza before I die because I have never kissed them, but then I get a hold of myself and tell myself it's better for them to be safe far from the war," she said.
Back at the Maqased, neonatal intensive care unit director Hatem Khammach says that in normal times, there would not have been space to keep Nour, Najmeh, and Najoua for so long.
'I cry every time'
But the number of births at the hospital has fallen sharply as Israel has stopped issuing travel permits to mothers from Gaza and slashed the number given to mothers from the occupied West Bank.
With more checkpoints closed more often, even those with a permit struggle to access specialist treatment in Jerusalem.
"Before the war, we had seven or eight Gaza babies in our department, which can host 30 at a time," Khammach said.
Since October, none have come, "and many sick people from the West Bank can't reach us".
But the hospital's health workers keep busy, like those who call Bayouk to let her speak on the phone to her three daughters.
"My husband can't do it. I do it and I cry every time we hang up. I'm afraid my daughters will grow up without knowing me," Bayouk said.
© 2024 AFP

author: Editor 4
title: Gypsy Rose Blanchard’s Husband Likes That She Clapped Back At Online Haters – Entertainment News 24/7 Updates
text: Gypsy Rose Blanchard and her husband Ryan Anderson are loving their new chapter together! The spouses spoke to Access Hollywood about being “newly-together-weds” following Gypsy’s release from prison and shared their hopes to start a family, each gushing over how the other would shine as a parent. Plus, the couple giggled as Access brought up Gypsy’s now-viral clapback at a troll sending Ryan hate. “I did like that my wife fought for me. It does feel good. Don’t mess with this one … She’s a firecracker,” Ryan said. Then, Gypsy answered some fun, rapid-fire questions, revealing her celebrity crush, favorite book, and the star she most wants to meet! Lifetime’s six-hour, three-night special “The Prison Confessions of Gypsy Rose Blanchard” premieres Jan. 5 at 8/7c and concludes on Jan. 7. Each night’s episodes stream on Lifetime the following day. “Released: Conversations on the Eve of Freedom” is out Jan. 9. Tune in to see more of Gypsy’s interview on “Access Hollywood” next week. author: Scott Baird
title: The Switch 2 is Finally Breaking Nintendo's Weirdest Rule For Online Play
text:
The first Nintendo Switch 2 Direct was a roaring success, as it confirmed lots of exciting things that fans have requested, including a practically open-world Mario Kart game and the addition of Nintendo GameCube titles to Nintendo Switch Online. The Nintendo Switch 2 is also adding video chat via the GameChat function, though it has one huge restriction that fans might not like.
Now that the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct is out of the way, fans can actually be excited for things more than magnets and grainy footage of a new Mario Kart game. The system is actually loaded with cool new features, including the implementation of a chat feature that fans have wanted for several systems now, yet Nintendo keeps dragging its feet, at least until 2025.
Nintendo’s Strange Chat History on the Switch Voice Chat On Nintendo Switch Has Been Very Limited Close Nintendo has always been slow to adapt to modern trends , and nowhere is this truer than with online play and communication between players. The dreadful quality of most of Nintendo’s servers is a symptom of this, and it’s why people who love online multiplayer tend to look at other platforms.
The restriction of communication between players online makes some sense, as Nintendo has always presented itself as a family-friendly company. That reputation will quickly melt away if kids enter online matches in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe and start getting called slurs by the adult players who should know better.
Related The Best Game Boy Games That Aren't on Nintendo Switch Online (Yet) Some of the best Game Boy games, including Pokémon Red and Blue and Tetris 2, have yet to make an appearance on Nintendo Switch Online.
Posts Nintendo took a very tentative step in allowing online contact during the Switch era, but it was a very bad one. Enter the Nintendo Switch Online app , which allowed multiple players to talk to each other via their phones. This service had a ton of restrictions, including requiring an active Nintendo Switch Online subscription to use.
Many fans quickly realized that playing with friends was easier via the regular chat apps, like Discord and Whatsapp . It was also easier to set up communication in those apps, so why bother with the Nintendo Switch Online method? The whole situation felt like a botched experiment, as Nintendo doesn’t want full voice chat, not when it has such a large audience of families to protect.
Nintendo Switch 2 GameChat Finally Adds Video Chat The Switch 2 Is Finally Catching Up With Other Consoles
Image Via Nintendo The age of silence is over, as the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct unveiled GameChat: the system’s video chat functionality . When active, the player can communicate or share their screen with up to three players. The group doesn’t have to be playing the same game, as the chat can simply share the screen of what’s happening at that moment in time. This was demonstrated by people playing Mario Kart World and all being in the same instance, with all four chats active at once. It’s also possible to shrink/enlarge the windows, depending on how busy the main player is, as gawking at someone playing Balan Wondeworld might not be wise for anyone trying to beat Malenia in the Nintendo Switch 2 port of Elden Ring .
In terms of technology, GameChat uses the built-in mic on the Nintendo Switch 2 to collect the voice of the player, and it will apparently do so even if there are loud noises in the room. The mic also works in handheld mode. While the built-in mic is used for voice, players will need to purchase the Nintendo Switch 2 Camera if they want to appear on-screen themselves, as they can do a Zoom meeting effect, where they appear in the foreground. Certain games can also turn the video feed into in-game assets, such as Mario Party having each player’s head above their character.
It bears mentioning that GameChat has a huge drawback: the frame rate . The footage shown during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct , which was meant to showcase the feature at its best, had the absolute worst garbage frame rate imaginable. Chances are, GameChat is going to look even worse with people of varying Internet speeds.
Related 10 Forgotten Nintendo Characters Who Belong In Mario Kart 9 Mario Kart 9 has the chance to dust off some forgotten and underutilized Nintendo characters and bring them back as race kart drivers.
Posts 3 In order to use the GameChat functionality, players will need to hit the mysterious new C Button, which was first revealed by leaks, but was only spoken about during the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct. A lot of people guessed the C stood for “chat” and they were correct. Pressing the C button brings up the different GameChat options, so it’s all within easy access, and muting the mic/cutting the video feed is all within a single button click away.
As it’s an online service, players will need a Nintendo Switch Online subscription in order to use GameChat, but it will be free for early adopters until March 31, 2026 . This means that people don’t have to pay for the online chat for nearly a year, so Nintendo is at least bold about promoting the service. However, considering that Nintendo Switch 2 will add GameCube titles (via the Expansion Pass), it wouldn’t be surprising to see people already hooked to the service without needing to utilize the freebie.
Considering Nintendo has its family-friendly image to consider, there are also extensive Parental Controls for GameChat. Parents with kids who own a Nintendo Switch 2 can set the Parental Controls, so that they can control when and who they can use the video chat feature with. This is controlled with a phone app, which makes it clear which people are attempting to engage with GameChat, even if they’ve changed their in-game name at some point in time.
It all sounds perfect. However, Nintendo being Nintendo, they had to throw one major caveat into the mix. GameChat might have a lot of positive features, but those expecting something as free-form as what’s available on PCs and other consoles have another thing coming.
The Big Caveat to GameChat On Nintendo Switch 2 It's Time to Start Sharing Switch Friend Codes
Image Via Nintendo As confirmed by the official Nintendo website, anyone who wants to use GameChat can only do so with people on their Friend List. This means no random encounters with people met online in games like Mario Kart World , as it’s only possible to use GameChat with those already known by the player.
While not the biggest shock in the world, it’s a shame that Nintendo didn’t include an option for people who can confirm their age to have GameChat unlocked. Then again, it would probably be more hassle than it’s worth, both from a programming standpoint and from a PR standpoint.
Related 10 Features Mario Kart 9 Needs If Nintendo Wants It To Be Better Than MK8 Nintendo revealed that a new Mario Kart game is coming to the Switch 2, and it will need certain features to overcome Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.
Posts All it would take is for a few articles about people being awful to strangers via Nintendo Switch 2 GameChat for Nintendo to have to start weathering a PR nightmare. If GameChat wasn’t locked to the Friend List, then people would be racing to see who would be the first to get banned from the service.
Of course, there’s nothing stopping friends from acting the fool with each other, and if anyone is being a jerk, there’s also a report option, ensuring people stay in line. These things just have to be contained in a bubble, and if people act like scumbags, then the consumer has no recourse if they’re the ones adding them to their Friend List.
GameChat Is a Big Step Forward for Nintendo GameChat Shows Nintendo Is Willing to Embrace New Ideas Close Friend List limitations aside, the implementation of GameChat is an awesome upgrade for the Nintendo Switch 2. The presence of the Nintendo Switch 2 Camera also feels like a precursor to a new iteration down the road , one that has a camera built, kind of like the Game Boy Camera from back in the day. The framerate in GameChat is already at the same level as the Game Boy Camera , so the Switch 2’s own camera may as well stick out the top.
Related 10 Nintendo Characters We Need To See In Mario Kart 9 These are the fantastic and iconic Nintendo characters that badly deserve a place on the roster of the upcoming Mario Kart 9 for the Switch 2.
Posts The feature feels tailor-made for games with great co-op gameplay, like Animal Crossing: New Horizons and PowerWash Simulator . The ability to share a screen natively with a friend online without needing any additional hardware is a great one, and it will be fascinating to see the weird ways in which Nintendo utilizes this hardware quirk.
When the Nintendo Switch 2 was revealed, people were annoyed that it seemingly had no hardware gimmicks like the other Nintendo systems before it. Well, the GameChat feature fills that role perfectly, especially in an age with so many great online games that can be enjoyed with friends.
Nintendo Switch
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->arts and entertainment
